instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.CHGR_ACOK: What is CHGR_ACOK? This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PP1V5_SO: What is PP1V5_SO? This is a typo of PP1V5_S0 When you see PP1V5_SO, assume they meant to type PP1V5_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: Hi, i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that isnt charging the battery, laptop boots to os, shows battery percentage and charging icon but wont charge the battery, also NO green light on charger, tried different battery and chargers same result , checked current sensing resistors on both circuits and even changed <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> just incase, could the issue be with the onewire circuit even though i thought that circuit had to work for the board to even turn on ???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: No green light so change IO board and flat cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
No light on the charger is the first issue to solve. 

1) is <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL> present on pin 14 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>? 
2) are the <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> pins on J4002?
3) Did you try a known good DC in board and DC in cable?

99% of the time it is a bad cable between dc in board & logic board, or burned pins on the connector for <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: thanks guys ill give it a try, just took out dc inboard and under the scope looks like the dc inboard has had a spill

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Hi you was right new dc in board and cable cured the charging issue but it has no sound, no chime at start no light in headphone jack, reset pram , what ive checked so far is:
<CHIP>U8040</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PP1V5_SO</SIGNAL> =1.5v audio enable =3.2v <SIGNAL>PP1V5_SOSW_AUDIO</SIGNAL> =1.5v
<CHIP>U6410</CHIP> have 5v at pvdd no im getting kinda lost :-(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: All audio is on the IO board so first suspect would be again the IO board or cable.
